Boston.com
10

Board gives 3 with life sentences early releases

The Parole Board's decision was the first time a life sentence was shortened since a convict on parole fatally shot a Woburn officer in 2010. (Globe, 2:17 p.m.)
  • 3/26 Backlog follows parole overhaul

Second Mattapan trial slated for Oct.

Dwayne Moore, who allegedly killed four people in Mattapan in 2010, will go on trial a second time Oct. 11, after a mistrial was declared last week. (Globe, 3:15 p.m.)
  • 3/22 Mistrial for Moore; Washington acquitted  |  Pictures

CDC: Autism rate rises to 1 in 88 children

Autism rate rises 23 percent

The number of US children diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder is 23 percent higher than rates found in earlier data, a new CDC study found. (Globe, 2:47 p.m.)
  • Discuss Are children are over diagnosed with autism?
  • Autism label controversy | Health Guide: What is autism?

Police mount massive search for occupants of car that struck trooper

With helicopters soaring above and SWAT teams deploying below, police searched a Dorchester neighborhood today for two people. (Globe, 3:31 p.m.)
  • Video Trooper hit by car in Neponset Circle  |  Pictures

Video of handcuffed shooter adds to Trayvon Martin debate in Florida

Martin's family says a police video of neighborhood watchman George Zimmerman does not show injuries he claims he suffered before the shooting. (AP, 3:42 p.m.)
  • Francie Latour Take a bite out of crime watch
  • Pictures Protests for Martin  |  Questions in shooting

Business

US jobless claims fall to lowest level in four years

The number of people seeking U.S. unemployment benefits dropped last week to the lowest level in four years, adding to evidence that the job market is strengthening.
